result.execSummary:
The defendant Damian A. Okeefe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Possession of Switchblade Knife, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.24(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay fine of $100 plus costs to include the Drug Abuse Surcharge and DNA surcharge.  To be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan.

Court will not allow credit. 
Huber for employment and any counseling he may be involved in. 
Must report today for start date and time. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Damian A. Okeefe

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Damian A. Okeefe in court with attorney Robert A. Gardner. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:52 p.m. Court calls the case. 

State files Amended Information. 
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Atty Gardner has received a copy of the Amended information and waives its reading. 

Defendant enters a plea of:  Counts 1, 3 & 4 - GUILTY

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Counts 1, 3 and 4.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 2 is dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Gardner makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 - Serve 30 days in jail. 
Court will not allow any credit. 
Huber for employment and any counseling he may be involved in. 
Must report today for start date and time. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Pay fine of $100 plus costs to include the Drug Abuse and DNA surcharge. To be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan. 

Counts 3 & 4 - 
Pay costs on each count.  To include the DNA surcharge. To be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan.
Plea hearing on January 22, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Pre-trial conference on November 24, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Damian A. Okeefe in court with attorney Robert A. Gardner. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 24, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 27, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

$5,000 sig bond:   Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Damian A. Okeefe in court with attorney James W. Gardner. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Time limits are waived for preliminary.

BTC:  $5,000 sig bond:   Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 27, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
